tagline: Systems Design Engineering - University of Waterloo

summary.text: Experience in mobile/web/desktop UX and product design since 2013.
Development and presentation of well-researched design deliverables, like user flows, personas, wireframes and detailed prototypes.
Collaboratively identifying and solving problems with designers, developers, PMs and other stakeholders in fast-paced environments.
Research and prioritization of user requirements, and translation into technical requirements.
Diverse education in UX, software, electrical, and mechanical engineering.

responsibilities.text: Performed user research, competitor analysis and A/B testing for a new subscription-based revenue model.
Configured the user flow and final parameters for a feature that increased daily news-feed app entry by 4%.
Designed initial wireframes and feature specifications for a new engagement feature expected to increase daily active users by 10%.
Analyzed player demographics by monthly spend to better know the sources of revenue, and which players to target for new features.
Managed, analyzed, and reported on key metrics for various in-app experiments.
Simplified the food logging experience to better fit with the observed mental model, without compromising functionality.
Leveraged data from rigorously user tested prototypes to inform further design iterations.
Initiated collaboration with users and stakeholders, and managed the early design process for a Coach Dashboard re-design.
Improved user confidence when logging food by simplifying the portion picker interface.
Built prototypes and designs using Sketch, Framer, and Origami, and tested using Usability Hub and UserTesting.com.
Overhauled design and structure of iOS and Android apps to make it simpler, more informative, and conform to common user behaviour.
Designed and built a sponsorship sign-up page from scratch using SASS, CoffeeScript and PHP.
Organized semiweekly design meetings with all stakeholders to present prototypes and discuss design of the mobile apps and websites.
Initiated and oversaw the preliminary design of the new company homepage, and corporate portal.
Improved the flow of the app to correspond with the 3 use-phases of the product.
Created, branded and optimized a core company service, now called ReachMe.
Designed and prototyped a retail stand for dispensing product boxes and displaying product information in retail stores.
Designed a new product package concept, reducing the box side by 50% by leveraging unique features of the KnowRoaming product.
Storyboarded, and animated an app intro video for the updated KnowRoaming app.
Created 3D concept models of an automated sticker application device using AutoCAD and Inventor.
Spearheaded design and development for a new music-discovery/radio feature for MediaGo, built in SASS and jQuery.
Proposed a UI re-design of MediaGo, improving aesthetics and clarity.
Designed promotional graphics and videos for MediaGo.
Developed the front-end for the new feature using HTML, SASS and jQuery.

projects.name: Chameleon
projects.description: Smart hearing protection that automatically adjusts its attenuation based on the environment.

responsibilities.text: Researched user needs and current behaviour to inform design, and technical requirements.
Managed project priorities, and led development of mechanical, software and electronic systems.
Developed analog circuit to determine the perceived loudness at the ear.
Developed device testing validation procedures and software.
Designed ear-cup and variable attenuation mechanism.
Developed exposure prediction and actuator control logic on Teensy.

projects.name: SMRT WATR
projects.description: An interactive IoT water fountain that reacts to player responses in a web-based quiz game.

responsibilities.text: Designed and built the game interface using JavaScript and a Tornado Python server.
Constructed the fountain frame, basin, and designed a mechanism to rotate the fountain jet.
Developed the web-app front-end, and a portion of the Python server.
Designed and built the fountain frame and water basin.

projects.name: Colour Thermometer
projects.description: A web app that represents the current temperature, weather conditions and time as an HSV colour.

projects.name: TAP Metronome
projects.description: A simple iOS metronome app with a minimal interface. Built independently for Hack The North 2016.

projects.name: Say No To Comic Sans
projects.description: A Chrome extension that scans a site for Comic Sans, and replaces it with Helvetica.

projects.name: Analog Single-Note Guitar Tuner
projects.description: An analog circuit that uses a series of band-pass filters, and envelope detector, and rectifier to discern whether the high-E string is in tune.

projects.name: Arduino VU Meter
projects.description: An Arduino system that takes samples from a mono-audio channel and outputs the relative volume on an array of LEDs.

projects.name: STiC - Ski Tip Connector
projects.description: A mechanical device to allow instructors of disabled skiers to more easily control and guide their students.

responsibilities.text: Designed the rod-and-ring mechanism to ensure the wearer’s skis do not cross.
Designed and modelled the device body and built the initial prototype.

courses.name: Cognitive Ergonomics
courses.description: This course focuses on the role engineering psychology research plays in design of the information displays and devices associated with simple and complex cognitive tasks.

courses.name: Intro to Control Systems
courses.description: Classical and state space representations of control systems. Stability, controllability, observability and sensitivity. Frequency domain behaviour, Bode plots, Nyquist stability criteria. Pole placement, PID, phase-lead and phase-lag controllers.

courses.name: User Centred Design
courses.description: The focus in this coures was on human factors and usability methods and techniques that should be applied throughout the design process, including: function and task analysis, usability analysis, prototyping and evaluation, user interaction styles, interface design, user designing to guidelines and standards

courses.name: Engineering Design
courses.description: In this class, we learned about the design process; from problem definition to ideation and prototyping. We practiced what we were learning with a term-long design project. Our team designed an interactive water fountain

courses.name: Mechanics of Deformable Solids
courses.description: We explored the mechanics involved in stress and strain on common engineering materials. Our final was to build a cardboard bridge and estimate its failure load.

courses.name: Circuits & Instrumentation
courses.description: his course covered op-amps, analog filters and various transducers. We covered measurement and instrumentation devices, and hight, low and band-pass filters. My final project involved designing and building a single-note guitar tuner using an instrumentation amplifier, and a series of band-pass filters

courses.name: Intro to Cognitive Science
courses.description: This course was an introduction to the field of cognitive science. We covered many of the approaches to the field such as the Computational-Reperesentational Understandind of the Mind (CRUM), and others.

courses.name: Human Factors in Design
courses.description: We were introduced to needs-analysis, user interviews, ergonomics and user testing.
